title: Front Desk Agent Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Dalhousie University in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: It’s was pretty easy. They asked you basic questions and situational questions like how you would deal with different workplace situations and how you would handle conflicts. There were two interviewers and they took turns asking me different questions.
Interview Questions: Describe the time when you had to deal with a conflict at a workplace

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dalhousie University
Interview Descriptions: Regular asking about your background intentions nd what are your plans I. The future talking about the payments and these kinda stuff also asking technical questions depending on your background and field you are applying
Interview Questions: What is your future plans

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS)
Interview Descriptions: It was an easy interview. First there was introduction and then described work during Ph.D. and how could I contribute to their lab? Overall, it was friendly interview. Also, I told my career expectations and how could that lab help me in future endevaors.
Interview Questions: What was your work duering Ph.D.?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dalhousie University
Interview Descriptions:
Shortly after I submitted my application, I got an invitation for a video interview conducted through Dal. 
Simple behaviour questions. 
- Tell me about yourself
- How to solve the conflicts
Interview Questions:
Simple behaviour questions. 
- Tell me about yourself
- How to solve the conflicts

title: Administrative Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dalhousie University in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: The process was clearly explained at the start of the call to schedule the interview, and I was advised that this was an initial screening interview. The staff was well-spoken, clear, concise.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Classroom Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dalhousie University
Interview Descriptions: submit the resume, and get contacted in two weeks, scheduled an interview. the interview took 45 minues. basick behaviour questions and some difficult technical quesiton. Overall it was a great experience
Interview Questions: tell me how you work in a team

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dalhousie University in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Depends on the people interviewing, it could get very technical with tests. There were about 10 questions, with a mixture of behavioural and technical. Initially I had to present about myself and then towards the end there was an assessment test.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why did you apply for this job?

title: Educational Development Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interviewer would mostly ask about yourself and your interests, also ask about situational questions and how you will react to them, should be straight forward and less technical, can get through with enough practice
Interview Questions: Situational question about how would you communicate in a bad situation

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call for both interviews. Interviews were conducted over Skype. A panel interviewed me both times. Very professional communications from the hiring manager and other staff members.  Definitely one of the best interview experiences I've had.  Questions were relevant to the role
Interview Questions: Tell us about a complex problem, how you organized your information and the decision you made.

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Dalhousie University
Interview Descriptions: eazy pz lemon squizy basic questions about pc and stuff like how to clean viruses in mac and in pc  and stuff like tht  and basic hr questions
Interview Questions: it reated things

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dalhousie University
Interview Descriptions: It is fairly very straight forward. You need to simply show your intentions of working as a TA with your resume, you are mostly liked to get a TA in one of your top three preferences of roles/courses.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dalhousie University
Interview Descriptions: took 20 min, they ask you motivation and why you want to do specific research.  then another meeting with people higher up. write a proposal and then wait for word
Interview Questions: why do you want to do research

title: Engineering Coop Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: coop office will send the link for the interview  and only one round, ask some behaviour questions and programming skill set.  Introduce their information, salary, begin date and work load.
Interview Questions:
Introduce your self 
Describe the Project you have implemented

title: ISWEP Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dalhousie University in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was short and breif easy to do. Not much has to be prepapred. They're looking more for compatibility than ability.  Smile and present yourself well. The interview isn't much of a big deal.
Interview Questions: - tell us about yourself

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: two rounds pannel, on campus interview. met with various big guys. No talking about salary and benefits. just a regular interview. not very difficult. and you do have a chance to visit campus, libraries.
Interview Questions: what types of support you would like the University provide you?

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, professional, clear and concise interview questions. Was explained duties, number of hours, schedule, hourly wage, number of shifts. Requirements and certifications for the job needed to be mailed to the hiring manager. Provided banking information and telephone number for set up with system.
Interview Questions:
Q: Tell us about yourself ?
Q: Strengths and weaknesses?
Q: What made you choose Dalplex?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Dalhousie University
Interview Descriptions: They mainly ask about personality and logistics questions, nothing too hard. Good to emphasize leadership skills and projects you are involved.  It is good to show you are confident and know what you are talking about.
Interview Questions: What methods will you use to ensure you deliver the results we expect?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dalhousie University in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions:
General Questions asked. Applied online through the online portal. 
It was a pleasant interview and very well arranged. 
Typical Questions like: Tell me about yourself, How can you contribute to this role. . .
Interview Questions: Typical Questions like: Tell me about yourself, How can you contribute to this role. . .

title: Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Must apply online first and then the interview with a representative of Human Resources and two people of the designated department (the Director and the Manager). The best way to enter Dalhousie University is through TEMP work.
Interview Questions: Deal with people

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Toronto, ON) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
F2F interview - general Q with the director
F2F panel - more detailed - 2  directors 
Develop strat plan for the department 
Present strat plan and then team interview 5+ people
Interview Questions: Spending 3 weeks developing a strat plan is excessive

title: IT Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4+ months. I interviewed at Dalhousie University in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very friendly and insightful, everyone was cordials. Only one invite for the interview to face panel of interviewers. answer questions based on the resume. Follow up came after 2weeks and i was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and your work experience?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Dalhousie University in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Informal interview process, quite relaxed and if you apply for a position you will likely get a position. All depends on the professor you would be working for and for which course.
Interview Questions: They asked your schedule availability to make tutorials.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: 1 month wait between for posting to close, 3 weeks between closing & first interview, 2 between first & second in person panel interview & 3 weeks for an offer. The process was disorganized, lengthy and tedious. If I hadn't really wanted the job, it was my dream job, I wouldn't have bothered based on the respect they showed prospective employees.
Interview Questions: Do you see yourself working at Dalhousie longterm, how do we fit with you career goals?

title: Student Navigator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: General troubleshooting with all OS. Ticketing system. You should be really confident about the macOS and linux troubleshooting. The confidence level of yours should be really high to be consider to be hired
Interview Questions: Trouble shoot

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dalhousie University
Interview Descriptions: Applying on line and get admitted. Selected by the department and get an offer. You need a personal statement and a resume about your experiences of research to prove your research background.
Interview Questions: What is the research work experience do you have.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked Basic interview questions like introduce yourself. what are your strengths and and other things like drawbacks etc etc. I had other easy Situation ques like conflicts with team members.
Interview Questions: All about resume

title: Clinical Study Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: they called almost 2 months after applying, but very standard questions. All situation based. it was over the phone so very difficult to understand but very obvious people were talking in the background and chatting with each other as it was a panel interview. Almost seemed they were interviewing just to say they had an interview with a number of people.
Interview Questions: What would you do if an SAE occured?

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions:
- Submit resume through dalhousie portal
- Some one will make a apppintment with you
- No phone interview, only 1:1 personal interview
- result out in 2 weeks
- good job
- interview takes too long
- result out thourgh dalhousie unline portal
Interview Questions: They ask lots of my previous experiences, and give me a mock environment to deal with broken systems

title: Surveyor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Aug 2016
Interview Questions: What is your understanding of the job, do you know what kind of job this gonna be?

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS)
Interview Descriptions: The interview process started well. However, as the process moved forward, the Committee was rather cold, overly formal for the position being applied for, and acted slightly haughty. I found the process was like a bad rip-off of something from The Apprentince, and no one interviewing me really understood the questions they were asking me. They also essentially asked me the same question in 5 different ways. Overall the Committee seemed disinterested, unpersonable, and amateur.
Interview Questions: Standard questions

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Online application and selection based on experience, school sent an email searching for TA's with in my program and students were invited to apply. Students were asked to submit their resumes and preference and then were selected based on availability.
Interview Questions: What my area of interests were.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Quite informal in her office and one-on-one... standard questions about my previous experience and why I am interested in the position. Nothing surprising. They were most interested in hearing about my quantitative abilities. No behavioural questions
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous research experience.

title: Sustainable Transportation Demand Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a very positive one. The person who I was talking to, took a very casual approach to the interview. They want to know how my skill set would translate to the new position,
Interview Questions: What would be two skills that you will be able to take to the new position?

title: PhD Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
Questions about basic CMOS
My advise is to clearly talk with your potential supervisor about PhD funding beforehand to avoid future pitfalls.
My supervisor called in in to his office for the interview and gauged my expectations versus what he wanted. In total he told me the minimum number of papers that I need to graduate.
Interview Questions:
Explain gain of a single stage CMOS CS amplifier.
Also questions about testing CMOS circuits.
Questions about PCB design to aid chip testing.
Questions about how much you need for funding.
He also wanted to know how many papers I would commit to publishing in my PhD.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Dalhousie University
Interview Descriptions: They hire students to work on campus in Internetworking department purely based on the grade of the student. In study break interested student ave to apply for the position and if it is available and you are best suited according to grades than other students who as applied you will be contacted by program manager.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Formal interivew process as it was for an intern position. This largely depends on the department within the instituion. Some departments tends to have a more formalized process while others do not. Overall, was a great experience. Involved panel discussions.
Interview Questions: Work experience

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the positions from an email that was circulated to all students in the school of planning. I was emailed by the professor saying that they were happy I had applied because they knew I had the ability to do the job based on course work. I met a few days later and had a short conversational interview about my GIS experience and they told me I was hired immediately.
Interview Questions: What is your research and Geographic Information Systems experience?

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS)
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was pretty informal. The team lead was looking for students to hire for a particular job, and did a fair amount of networking to figure out who would be best. He was committed to finding someone right for the position rather than filling headcount. We met over coffee, and talked about what needed to be done, and how my skills and experience would play into that. We also talked about whether and when I'd be available, and agreed to talk again closer to that time. It was clear that I was a good fit for the role and vice versa, so it was a natural choice.
Interview Questions: Whether I had experience with specific technologies or products that might be important in the role.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: No Interview needed, just apply through email and note the courses that you wish to TA for. You need to get a relatively high GPA to apply to be a TA.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was with the specific faculty member whom I applied to work for. I was then introduced to each member of the research group individually to inquire further about working within the group.
Interview Questions: Who is your favourite character from any piece of literature and why?

title: Undergraduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
In the office of the potential advisor, I was asked a few preliminary questions about my coursework, involving abstract algebra, analysis, and physics.

I was then casually asked about my background in quantum computation. Essentially, how long I had been studying the subject for, as well as a few basic questions with my familiarity with common terms and figures. 

After confirming that my academic record was sufficiently sound, we concluded the interview.
Interview Questions: What is the output of the following quantum circuit? (a fairly simple quantum circuit was drawn)

title: Marketing and Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: They already knew me from working in athletics, so the interview was brief and informal. They asked me to meet up and discussed the role that I would be applying for. They gave me a brief run down of the day-to-day processes and we discussed wages.
Interview Questions: What can I see myself doing in 10 years?

title: Senior Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a two phase interview - the first interview was 2 hours with the interview committee, along with 1 hour meeting with the Provost.  The second visit included a public presentation to the community, a second interview with the interview committee, a meeting with other members of the senior administration in the area I would be working, a meeting with the staff in the unit I would oversee, a tour of campus, and a final meeting with the Provost.
Interview Questions: What is your vision for Dalhousie in ____________ over the next five years?

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Anyone applying for a job that is not currently a member of one of Dalhousie's unions can expect to wait a while - usually over a month - for an interview callback. Dalhousie is required to screen all potential internal candidates before they start to contact external applicants.

Interviews are also done by department (for the Halifax campus, anyway) so there is no centralized interview done by HR. Because of this, your questions and overall experience may vary  - questions can be chosen or omitted at the discretion of the department manager who is interviewing you.
Interview Questions: None that I can recall. My experience was a standard personality test as the job I applied for was administrative in nature.

title: IT Help Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: got a phone call for an interview and then gave an interview . It was an easy interview. They usually ask about courses and classes and some general questions.Interview environment is very friendly . If answer for questions with confidence then its an easy interview.
Interview Questions: they asked me about my courses?

title: Clerk IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called by the Human Resources Department to set up the interview. Interviewers were one male and one female in a casual setting. There were the typical questions and lots of quiet moments. I was ill-prepared and glad I didn't get the job.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a difficult situation?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Dalhousie University in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: I went to 2 interviews. Great people to talk to. They value punctuality and commented on that. They explained me the projects they wanted me to work on and asked me how could I help them. We both knew I was the man for the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Truro, NS) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process was a major hassle.  I submitted an application and had nearly forgot that I applied for the job by the time I was offered an interview.  The questions they asked seemed very irrelevant to the position and now that I'm working, I can say they were ENTIRELY irrelevant.  It was quite a while after that they made me the job offer and MONTHS before I started work.  From job application to first day on the job - 5 months.
Interview Questions: All of the questions sounded as though they were selected by a committee of government bureauocrats in the early 90s.  They were all un-expected although easy enough to answer.

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Dalhousie University (Halifax, NS) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process covered the work in detail but did not express the need to be at the office 10 to 12 hours a day without extra pay.
Interview Questions: What do you bring to this position?
